pageContext.description: Metal very rough all the way round the edges. The section is nearly flat near the hilt, the mid-rib becoming more and more pronounced towards the point.
pageContext.patina: Traces of a dark 'flaky' patina down the centre, with grass-green patina round the edge. On the edges themselves, and on the mid rib near the point, are traves of tone bronze colour. There are also traces of a rust colour, and a white lumpy encrustment.
pageContext.surface: Smooth generally with 'lumps' where white encrustment occurs.
pageContext.collection: July 2, 1935, Thames Conservency to go later to Reading Museum,Now in Reading Museum
pageContext.site: England,Berkshire,Windsor,Dredged from R. Thames at Old Windsor below Victoria Bridge, by dredger working in 8' of water.,June-July, 1935
pageContext.toSearch: Windsor, Windsor, Windsor And Maidenhead Sl4, UK
